trans-unit.source: Discovering and Exposing a Service Bus Service
trans-unit.target: Discovering and Exposing a Service Bus Service

trans-unit.source: The following topics describe how to use the <token>sb2</token> service registry to register service endpoints, expose them in the registry, publish WSDL metadata exchange endpoints, and locate service endpoints that have been registered to be publicly visible.
trans-unit.target: The following topics describe how to use the <token>sb2</token> service registry to register service endpoints, expose them in the registry, publish WSDL metadata exchange endpoints, and locate service endpoints that have been registered to be publicly visible.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceRegistrySettings</codeEntityReference> behavior to publish a service endpoint in the ATOM 1.0 feed and to control the name that appears there.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceRegistrySettings</codeEntityReference> behavior to publish a service endpoint in the ATOM 1.0 feed and to control the name that appears there.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to navigate the endpoints published in the registry to obtain the one to which you want to connect.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to navigate the endpoints published in the registry to obtain the one to which you want to connect.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to publish an <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:System.ServiceModel.Description.IMetadataExchange</codeEntityReference> service endpoint on <token>sb2</token> to enable SOAP-based clients to create their client channels using tools such as those available in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to publish an <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:System.ServiceModel.Description.IMetadataExchange</codeEntityReference> service endpoint on <token>sb2</token> to enable SOAP-based clients to create their client channels using tools such as those available in Visual Studio.
